Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller.commands

Interface Command

All Known Implementing Classes:
ActivateCardCommand, BasicProductionCommand, BuyCardAction, ChooseLeaderCardsCommand, ChooseMarblesCommand, DiscardCardCommand, EndProductionCommand, EndTurnCommand, InitialiseLeaderCardsCommand, InitialiseResourcesCommand, InsertInWarehouseCommand, LeaderCommand, LeaderProductionCommand, LoginCommand, NormalActionCommand, NormalProductionCommand, PongCommand, ProductionCommand, QuitCommand, SelectPositionCommand, SelectResourcesFromWarehouseCommand, SetSizeCommand, ShiftResourcesCommand, UnknownCommand
public interface Command
this interface represent a command to do for the evolution of the game. in particular, when a player have to modify something, it create this object as static type (the dynamic one will be different depending on the function) and send it thought the network. the server will receive and process it, eventually modifying the game state

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default ResponseToClient acceptedMessage()
    this method build an object ResponseToClient to send to the client.
    default ResponseToClient errorMessage()
    this method build an object ResponseToClient to send to the client.
    ResponseToClient executeCommand​(java.util.List<CommandName> possibleCommands, ClientHandler client, java.util.List<CommandName> previousPossibleCommands)
    this method execute the command given in input, returning a message that will be sent to the client.
    CommandName getCmd()
    this method get the cmd associated with the command
    java.lang.String getConfirmMessage()
    this method return a string representing the confirm message associated with the command
    java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
    this method return a string representing the error message associated with the command
    default int getNumberOfPlayers()
    this method get the number of players that the client sent the method is used only in the subClass SetSizeCommand, otherwise it returns always 0

  • Method Details

    • getCmd

      CommandName getCmd()
      this method get the cmd associated with the command
      Returns:
      the cmd associated with the command

    • getErrorMessage

      java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
      this method return a string representing the error message associated with the command
      Returns:

    • getConfirmMessage

      java.lang.String getConfirmMessage()
      this method return a string representing the confirm message associated with the command
      Returns:
      a string representing the confirm message associated with the command

    • executeCommand

      ResponseToClient executeCommand​(java.util.List<CommandName> possibleCommands, ClientHandler client, java.util.List<CommandName> previousPossibleCommands) throws EndGameException
      this method execute the command given in input, returning a message that will be sent to the client. the method will change the internal model state depending on the dynamic type of the commandInterpreter
      Parameters:
      possibleCommands - these are the possible commands to eventually modify
      client - this is the handler to notify in case of a internal state change
      previousPossibleCommands - these are the possible commands referred to the previous command, that eventually may be modified
      Returns:
      the response to send to the client\s
      Throws:
      EndGameException

    • errorMessage

      default ResponseToClient errorMessage()
      this method build an object ResponseToClient to send to the client. in particular, it create it setting an error status
      Returns:
      the object ResponseToClient built with the input parameters

    • acceptedMessage

      default ResponseToClient acceptedMessage()
      this method build an object ResponseToClient to send to the client. in particular, it create it setting an accepted status
      Returns:
      the object ResponseToClient built with the input parameters

    • getNumberOfPlayers

      default int getNumberOfPlayers()
      this method get the number of players that the client sent the method is used only in the subClass SetSizeCommand, otherwise it returns always 0
      Returns:
      the number of players that the client sent
